title: Tolley ignores serious concerns at youth facility - NZ First
text:
Monday, 19 October, 2015 - 08:19 
The government has dismissed information highlighting serious issues at Korowai Manaaki youth facility, says New Zealand First. 
"The Minister of Social Development Anne Tolley claims serious allegations of unsafe practices at Korowai Manaaki are being investigated and concerns are being dealt with," says New Zealand First Spokesperson for Social Development Darroch Ball. 
"If that is true why did the government stop the details of those allegations being tabled in Parliament? 
"The Minister has made no attempt to establish exactly what those allegations are, showing a lack of concern for both the youth and staff at Korowai Manaaki. 
"What sort of investigation is Mrs Tolley trying to manage when there is uncertainty about whether she knows who made the allegations, when they were made or exactly what those allegations entail. 
"If the Minister is serious about ensuring there is a safe environment at Korowai Manaaki she should put politics aside and work with New Zealand First to progress the investigation. 
"Korowai Manaaki Youth Justice Facility in South Auckland requires immediate intervention and further oversight," say Mr Ball.
